session-id.name: session-id
session-id.description: Optional session identifier of the user.

event_dict.title: Invalid Authorization header
event_dict.description: Please provide the right authorization token

client_category_id.description: This is an identifier used to help group and categorize the millions of consumer products in our database. It will be used as a request parameter in several of our API calls.

client_category.description: This is the display name for each product category.

cid.description: The cid is the identifier that matches the `client_category_id` to ValueChecker’s internal product categories. This value is for reference only and can be ignored.

has_replacement.description: Shows whether the `client_category_id` is considered a “Replacement category” by ValueChecker. “Replacement Categories” represent product groupings that ValueChecker has defined Like-Kind-and-Quality replacement logic for -- which means a comprehensive search to find relevant Replacement Products based on objective specification values can be completed for products in these categories. All `client_category_id’s` where `has_replacement` = True are considered “Replacement Categories”. Where `has_replacement` = False, ValueChecker is still able to search for the product and find real-time pricing information; however, there is no ability to search for Replacement Products within these categories.

acv_disabled.description: Informs as to whether the category has depreciation calculations associated with it. Depreciation can be applied in the Calculate ACV call.

parameters.name: client_reference
parameters.description: This must be unique to your client, otherwise we return an error. The response will contain the client_reference_id which is used in later calls.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: User-input string. The **user** should enter the name of the product being claimed / searched for.

parameters.name: client_category
parameters.description: Optional category selected or defined by the **user**.

parameters.name: client_category_id
parameters.description: Optional correlating ID of the category selected by the **user**.

parameters.name: force_client_category
parameters.description: Optional flag to force the use of the requested category.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: User-input string. The **user** should enter the name of the product being claimed / searched for.

parameters.name: client_category_id
parameters.description: Optional correlating ID of the category selected by the **user**.

parameters.name: client_category
parameters.description: Optional category selected or defined by the **user**.

parameters.name: force_client_category
parameters.description: Optional flag to force the use of the requested category.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.description: The product identifier (usually selected from the product search response).

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country in where prices will be searched.

grouped_prices.shop_product_name: Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max (1 TB) - Gold
Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max (1 TB) - Deep Purple

cpid.description: This is the Claimed Product Identifier. You should have this value from the previous response Step 3: (RP) from field `claimed_product.pid`.

rpid.description: This is the Replacement Product Identifier. The previous response should have one or more Replacement Products. You should take the value from whichever product you select from field `grouped_prices.[Y].[X].pid` (where X is the numbered product of the Y numbered group).

replacement_cost_value.description: This is an optional variable parameter. You can either use the price from the previous response from field `grouped_prices.[Y].[X].total_price` or you can set a custom value based on your own logic.

example.error: cpid : field required; rpid : field required

get.summary: All Apprisals In Specific Client Reference

delete.summary: Delete All Appraisals In Specific Client Reference

rpid.description: This is the Replacement Product Identifier. The previous response should have one or more Replacement Products. You should take the value from whichever product you select from field `grouped_prices.[Y].[X].pid` (where X is the numbered product of the Y numbered group).

cp_name_cart.description: Custom name for the claimed product (the cpid cannot be changed).

rp_name_cart.description: Custom name for the replacement product.

cp_price_estimate.description: The value claimed by the policyholder (Purchase Price / Repair).

example.error: The replacement cost value is needed to calculate the ACV.

event_dict.title: Missing parameter
event_dict.description: The replacement_cost_value is needed to calculate the ACV.
